column2: Hi There, can someone help me restoring ethers ? __eou__

I had trouble with the new version 0.8.7  it would not sync properly , it was syncing but was so slow it would never have cought up with it's self . I have now gone back to 0.8.6 .Could my problems have been due to the hard fork as that was the reason i updated to 0.8.7 ? Seeing as the Gethub site said the update was for those that use Mist and did not effect those that are just using the wallet as it does not access the internet. __eou__

I have read that others also had trouble syncing the new version 0.8.7 and that is the reason i stop trying with 0.8.7 and went back to 0.8.6 . I think it may follow the wrong Chain at block 1,346,??? not shore about that but the chain data started to bloat and get very big conpared to the size of the chain data that i currently have with 0.8.6 that was up to date as of about 36 hrs ago __eou__

I also had trouble with 0.8.6 the first time . It would not sync . I then use Gerth and reved DB and then reloaded it the chain data with this command geth --fast --support-dao-fork --cache=512 --maxpeers 99 --jitvm and this worked __eou__
Don't know what you have done but i am getting F-ing pissed off with the wallet not syncing and what the hell has the wallet downloaded new binary's ?????? __eou__

Geth folder now has to folders with binary's what the hell is the new binay for , i now have 3 versions of geth 2 in the folder Geth in there own folders and 1 version in the geth folder. So witch version is the correct one we should be using ????????????????????????????????????????? F-me you just can't help yourself but F-up every month or 2 can you ! __eou__
i am having the same issue but, be patient, i just got the latest geth version , try to install it and then start it.. it will start syncing __eou__
[<-LINK->]  __eou__
once installet go to progra files/geth and start it __eou__
make sure you have the latest mist version [<-LINK->]  __eou__

just read the news so the chain split , well i can report i just ran the new grth and it's even worse the the origanal version that is loaded with 0.8.6 . In other words i don't think the patch is working . I am not using Mist just the wallet __eou__
I ask again is it ok to delete empty accounts by deleting the key in the keystore folder and if i do that will it cause a problem ???? __eou__
what's the bet the stuff up has been caused by Zcash being linked with ether it is the same group that''s released Zcash that is doing ether . __eou__
Zcash is not worth doing for those that see the big price and think they can earn some quick cash mining it __eou__

gtx 970 using Nicehash cuda 8 gives only 19 sols , I have just run Zcash for 24 hrs with everything going  gtx 970 using cuda and 680 using open cl as it wont work with the cuda and 4 of 8 cores running got me 0.00501 Zcash  good luck with that one as it seems only big miners with heaps of cash to buy the latest CPU's and you will need at least 20 will be able to mine it __eou__
ops the latest GPU's and you will need at least 20 will be able to mine it __eou__
if you wish to do anonomous transcation then use Dash coin and don't worry about Zcash __eou__
you can mine Dash a lot easyer than Zcash and is more profitable too __eou__

Good night i will leave the wallet to sync as it does seem to be syncing but very slowly and the Chain data has grown by 1.3 gig for only aprox 3,200 blocks witch does not seem right , there is still 7,00 to go so i will check it in a few hours but i suspect that the patch does not work with 0.8.6 or does not do what you thought it would do __eou__

so i'll let it finish see how big the chain gets note it down and then redo the whole thing and see how big the chaindata folder is and let you know , if it is smaller then your patch is not working but i will let you know tomorrow so good night __eou__

DZExpats_twitter: For working with ethereum you need to start understanding blockchain, smart contracts and solidity programming language __eou__

You say you need and "identity card", a "card", I imagine a chip card, right? This chip card should be programmer to sign an ethereum transaction, then you should study Java Card Programming [<-LINK->]  __eou__
There is tools in Java for ethereum, so you might just grab some code. __eou__
Ask for help with Ethereum + Java im ethereumj room [<-LINK->]  __eou__
If you are able to develop an Java Card that signs an ethereum transaction to your identity register smart contract, you will be able to have what you want. __eou__
BTW, with this card you could even release $ETH, needing some password, if you program so. __eou__
Why you need a smart contract in first place? I think to recover in case of theft of loss of idcard, and for storing some information. Check [<-LINK->]  __eou__
was away __eou__
There are many aprooches for what you want to do, we would need to have an extensive study case to know what's better for you, but that should be your work ;) __eou__
Feel free to ask me questions about smart contract, blockchain, ethereum, wallet clients, and so on. __eou__
